section.title: Usage information
section.p: The remedy element is a component of a cause and remedy pair. The remedy might be omitted if there is no known remedy for the cause.
section.draft-comment:
component of a <troubleSolution> element.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The remedy element is specialized from section. It is defined in the troubleshooting module.

example.title: Example
example.p: In the following code sample, the remedy element contains instructions for how the responsible party can fix the problem. Note that rather than cross-referencing to another topic, the steps element from an existing topic is reused.

div.p: Dawn: should this just be a reference to the main example? or a conref of the section from that example?
Unfortunately, we cannot conref a portion of a code sample without introducing markup into the code sample. We could put the code snippet into a TXT file and use coderef to include it ...

example.codeblock: <troubleSolution> <cause>A recurring memory fault indicates a possible problem with the the system memory board. Reseating the board might fix the problem. </cause> <remedy> <steps conref="reseatBoard.dita#reseatBoard/steps"> <step><cmd/></step> </steps> </remedy> </troubleSolution>
